Events that occurred on 17 December.

content.title: On Earth
content.content:
1910 – J.R.R. Tolkien is awarded an Open Classical Exhibition for classical languages to Exeter College.
1936 – Actress Marian Diamond is born.
1937 - Charles Furth writes a letter to J.R.R. Tolkien.
1944 - Actor Bernard Hill is born.
1947 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes a letter to Malcolm Knox.
1967 - J.R.R. Tolkien and his wife went to see The Hobbit musical performance.
1972 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes Letter 347.
2003 – The Lord of the Rings: The Return of the King is released in cinemas worldwide.
2003 - Actor Alan Tilvern dies.
2014 - The Hobbit: The Battle of the Five Armies is released in the United States.
2017 - "There Would Always Be a Fairy Tale": Essays on Tolkien's Middle-earth is published.

content.title: In Arda
content.content:
T.A. 3018:
Frodo and Samwise rest in Rivendell and prepare for their quest to destroy the One Ring.
